sbol:Collection.dcterms:title: iGEM Parts Registry
sbol:Collection.dcterms:description: The iGEM Registry is a growing collection of genetic parts that can be mixed and matched to build synthetic biology devices and systems. As part of the synthetic biology community's efforts to make biology easier to engineer, it provides a source of genetic parts to iGEM teams and academic labs.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: "Lock"
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:description: lox66 + rpCons + hixC + lox71 + SapI + T + T + Hin enhancer + HindIII + hixC
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: This composite part is a prefix ???lock??? cassette requiring consecutive recombination by Hin and Cre, in that order, to express a gene downstream of the hixC site. The SapI restriction site can be used to insert DNA with ATC sticky ends in order to modify the length of recombination. After Hin recombination, the part becomes: lox66 + rpCons + hixC + HindIII + rHin enhancer + T + T + SapI + lox71 + hixC. When Cre is used after Hin, the part becomes: mloxP + SapI + T + T + Hin enhancer + HindIII + hixC + pCons + loxP + hixC.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Justin Vrana, Nate Pantalone
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: Note that the constitutive promoter is oriented to express whatever gene is downstream of the final hixC site.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: hixC
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:description: hixC binding site for Salmonella typhimurium Hin recombinase
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: A 26 bp sequence of DNA composed of 12 bp inverted repeats and a 2 bp core that operates in Salmonella paired with a hixR binding site to recombine DNA. A second hix site is required for recombination to occur. The two sites bind Hin recombinase in the formation of an invertasome.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Missouri Western and Davidson Groups, Todd Eckdahl
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: Nanassy and Hughes. 1998. In Vivo Identification of Intermediate Stages of the DNA Inversion Reaction Catlyzed by the Salmonella Hin Recombinase [http://www.genetics.org/cgi/content/abstract/149/4/1649]
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: Standard BioBrick prefix and suffix were added to the 26 bp sequence.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_B1006
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: Artificial terminator, estimated %T~>90% *8bp stem, 6nt loop *Bidirectional, estimated reverse %T~>90%
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Haiyao Huang
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: modified E. coli thr terminator, replaced all A-T pairs in stem with C-G pairs
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: Bidirectional, with the reverse estimated to be less effective than the forward. Has a polyA tail of 9 residues.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K318052
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: BBa_J3101 with a HindIII site added to the end.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Nathaniel Pantalone

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_B1006
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: Artificial terminator, estimated %T~>90% *8bp stem, 6nt loop *Bidirectional, estimated reverse %T~>90%
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Haiyao Huang
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: modified E. coli thr terminator, replaced all A-T pairs in stem with C-G pairs
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: Bidirectional, with the reverse estimated to be less effective than the forward. Has a polyA tail of 9 residues.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: lox71
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription:
Lox71 is a site specific recombination cassette. It belongs to the loxP family frequently used in genetics, particularly in mouse genetics.
lox site recombination is catalysed by a Site specific recombinase, Cre.
lox sequences are composed of an 8 bp Core sequence surrounded by two Arms.
The particularity of lox66 is that it has an altered sequence at the end of it's left arm compared to loxP. This sequence variation reduces affinity of the Cre recombinase for the arm. As a consequence, after a recombination between a lox71 and a lox66 (altered right arm sequence), one of the two resulting generated lox sites has very low recombination potential as it inherited both mutated arms. Use of lox71 & lox66 sites is potentially interesting when the recombination reaction must be "irreversible".
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Eimad Shotar
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance:
This part was generated in the form of a forward & a reverse primer. After annealing these primers EcoRI & PstI compatible cohesive ends at the 5' & 3' ends of the dsDNA were generated.
Next, the dsDNA was subcloned in a pSB1A2 open plasmid (digested with EcoRI & PstI)
You can follow the construction process by following the links available in the Paris iGEM 2007 wiki:
http://parts.mit.edu/igem07/index.php/Paris "freezer" section plasmids table. A links sends you to the corresponding notebook date when the ligation reaction was performed
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: No modifaication was made on lox71 sequence

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K318051
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: SapI site for junk DNA addition by multimerization of oligonucleotides.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Nathaniel Pantalone
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: The three bases that make up the sticky ends after digestion are ATC

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: hixC
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:description: hixC binding site for Salmonella typhimurium Hin recombinase
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription: A 26 bp sequence of DNA composed of 12 bp inverted repeats and a 2 bp core that operates in Salmonella paired with a hixR binding site to recombine DNA. A second hix site is required for recombination to occur. The two sites bind Hin recombinase in the formation of an invertasome.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Missouri Western and Davidson Groups, Todd Eckdahl
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: Nanassy and Hughes. 1998. In Vivo Identification of Intermediate Stages of the DNA Inversion Reaction Catlyzed by the Salmonella Hin Recombinase [http://www.genetics.org/cgi/content/abstract/149/4/1649]
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: Standard BioBrick prefix and suffix were added to the 26 bp sequence.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: lox66
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription:
lox66 is a site specific recombination cassette. It belongs to the loxP family frequently used in genetics, particularily in mouse genetics.
lox site recombination is catalysed by a Site specific recombinase, Cre.
lox sequences are composed of an 8 bp Core sequence surrounded by two Arms.
The particularity of lox66 is that it has an altered sequence at the end of it's left arm compared to loxP. This sequence variation reduces affinity of the Cre recombinase for the arm. As a consequence, after a recombination between a lox66 and a lox71 (altered right arm sequence), one of the two resulting generated lox sites has very low recombination potential as it inherited both mutated arms. Use of lox66 & lox71 sites is potentially interresting when the recombination reaction must be "irreversible".
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Eimad Shotar
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance:
This part was generated in the form of a forward & a reverse primer. After annealing these primers EcoRI & PstI compatible cohesive ends at the 5' & 3' ends of the dsDNA were generated.
Next, the dsDNA was subcloned in a pSB1A2 open plasmid (digested with EcoRI & PstI)
You can follow the construction process by following the links available in the Paris iGEM 2007 wiki:
http://parts.mit.edu/igem07/index.php/Paris "freezer" section plasmids table. A links sends you to the corresponding notebook date when the ligation reaction was performed
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: No modidification was made on the lox66 sequence

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K318050
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Nathaniel Pantalone
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: This part expresses very strongly. Pick smaller colonies when screening.
